pageContext.claim: “Six months after our TAX CUTS, more than 6 MILLION workers have received bonuses, pay raises, and retirement account contributions.”
pageContext.analysis: With about 126 million full-time workers in the United States, only about 5% have received these one-time bonuses. Plus, a Morgan Stanley analysis found that companies are more than three times as likely to allocate the tax savings to buybacks & dividends than labor compensation.
